attributes.action: Boris Johnson & Rishi Sunak  broke the law, will they both offer to resign?
attributes.additional_details:
They have brought the government into disrepute with their actions and misled parliament. They are supposed to represent the public, all this gives the view that Rules and Laws can be ignored. 

Whether you're in government or not, rules and laws are expected to be adhered too. The office of Prime Minister is not a licence to do as you please. Time to bring back some integrity to politics and show the voters that politicians are not above the consequences of law breaking.
attributes.background: I would like you to ask for a vote of no confindence in both the prime minister and the chancellor with out conservative members being forced to vote for the goverments side.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for MPs or Ministers to be sacked or for them to resign.
